thig13.5:1.1: In the past, when I was young and living a pure life,
thig13.5:1.4: there was realization of the truth.
thig13.5:2.3: Having seen the danger in identity view,
thig13.5:3.1: Having abandoned the company of relatives,
thig13.5:4.1: I have given up much wealth
thig13.5:4.2: for the sake of going forth.
thig13.5:4.3: Thus I have left the household life
thig13.5:4.4: out of faith in the well-spoken true Dhamma.
thig13.5:5.2: for anyone who wished for no posessions.
thig13.5:5.3: To come back to gold and silver
thig13.5:6.2: is not for enlightenment nor for peace.
thig13.5:6.3: This isn't proper for a contemplative,
thig13.5:7.4: and its duration is not long.
thig13.5:8.1: Here infatuated with lust and negligent,
thig13.5:9.4: one can be seen to be afflicted with much misfortune.
thig13.5:10.2: why do you try to yoke me with sensual pleasures?
thig13.5:10.3: You know I have gone forth
thig13.5:10.4: seeing the danger in sensual pleasures.
thig13.5:11.2: are the pollutants of mind eliminated.
thig13.5:12.2: why do you try to yoke me with sensual pleasures?
